tasks.description: Filter the data point representing January 2020 on the x-axis
tasks.label: January

steps.aoiDescription: First, locate the entire area containing the x-axis labels for all months.
Precisely identify the x-axis label for 'January' within the axis labels area.

tasks.description: Retrieve the oil price value for January 2020 from the y-axis.
tasks.label: January

steps.aoiDescription: Trace a vertical line upward from the January label until you reach the corresponding oil price data point.
Locate the rectangular area representing the oil price data point for January 2020.
Visually scan horizontally from the January data point toward the y-axis to read the corresponding oil price value.
Focus your attention on the closest y-axis tick where your horizontal eye scan meets the axis. This helps confirm the oil price value for January.

tasks.description: Find the minimum oil price among all retrieved monthly prices.
tasks.label: April

steps.aoiDescription: Locate the tick on the y-axis that aligns with the lowest oil price observed across all months. This helps confirm the minimum price for April.
Draw a horizontal reference line from the y-axis to the data point representing the minimum oil price in April.
Trace a vertical line downward from the data point to identify the corresponding month (April) on the x-axis.
Locate the x-axis label for April to confirm the month with the minimum oil price.

tasks.description: Find the maximum oil price among all retrieved monthly prices.
tasks.label: January

steps.aoiDescription: Locate the tick on the y-axis that aligns with the highest oil price observed across all months. This helps confirm the maximum price for January.
Draw a horizontal reference line from the y-axis to the data point representing the maximum oil price in January.
Trace a vertical line downward from the data point to identify the corresponding month (January) on the x-axis.
Locate the x-axis label for January to confirm the month with the maximum oil price.

tasks.description: Determine the price range by identifying the difference between the maximum and minimum oil prices.

steps.aoiDescription: Locate the tick on the y-axis that represents the highest oil price (January) to begin range comparison.
Locate the tick on the y-axis that represents the lowest oil price (April) to complete range comparison.
Draw a vertical line between the highest and lowest price points directly on the y-axis to visualize the full oil price range.
